title: 111_hr3657
content: Members of the United States Public Health Service and National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps can transfer unused benefits under the Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program to family members. The amendment allows members of the Armed Forces to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents to promote recruitment and retention. Members of the United States Public Health Service can also transfer benefits to family members. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may allow members of the United States Public Health Service to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents, while the Secretary of Commerce may permit members of the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to do the same. The section allows eligible individuals in the Armed Forces to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents, subject to certain conditions. Eligible individuals must have completed six years of service and agree to serve an additional four years. The section allows eligible individuals in the Armed Forces, United States Public Health Service, and National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents, subject to certain conditions. Eligible individuals must have completed six years of service and agree to serve an additional four years. The section allows eligible individuals in the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents after completing six years of service and agreeing to serve an additional four years. In subsection (g), the amendment allows members of the United States Public Health Service and National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents after completing service requirements. In subsection (h), amendments allow members of the Armed Forces, United States Public Health Service, or National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents after completing service requirements. Amendments in subsection (h) allow members of the Armed Forces, United States Public Health Service, or National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents after completing service requirements. Additionally, the term "appropriate Secretary" is defined in subsection (l) as the Secretary of Defense for Armed Forces matters and the Secretary of Health and Human Services for Public Health Service matters. The amendments in the Act allow members of the Armed Forces, Public Health Service, and National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration Corps to transfer educational assistance entitlement to dependents. The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008.
